@BRockFit By the way, our industry, which you hate, does not receive such gov't benefits.
@BRockFit I'm surprised that as a lib you're not a crony capitalist. Gov't contracts and subsidies are how gov't controls  business.
@BRockFit However, crony capitalism is a negative and the result of gov't being too big.
@BRockFit Well, GE isn't really "Wall Street."  Wall Street is also a  big plus for our economy at all levels.
@BRockFit By the way, the CEOs of Goldman and GE are big supporters of Obama.  Ever wonder why?
@BRockFit I don't.
@BRockFit Why do you assume I'm OK with it. I don't want businesses beholden to gov't.  That's a Dem thing.
@BRockFit In fairness, oil company subsidies aren't something I know much about.
@BRockFit Its not in my control.  Obviously, both Dems and Repubs have failed to stop it.
@BRockFit Why didn't the Dems stop it when they controlled both houses of congress and the presidency?
@BRockFit Yes.  Fannie and Freddie set the standards. Banks made the loans and set up the securitizations.
@BRockFit Residents if states with low or no state income taxes pay a higher percentage of their income to the fed gov't.
@BRockFit California gets the most from the Federal government.  Factor in high state taxes that are deductible from Federal taxes.
@BRockFit Who said corporate welfare was IK? Not I. Government shouldn't be picking winners and losers.  Solyndra, Fisker, Ethanol, etc.
@BRockFit Shouldn't have bailed them out either. Real estate bubble caused by low interest rates and unqualified borrowers.
@BRockFit And I would oppose it as I do corporate welfare.  The Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac were the primary culprits in the last collapse.
@BRockFit Free Market capitalism.
@BRockFit Only one economic system has ever generated sufficient economic growth to meaningfully reduce poverty and increase opportunity.
@BRockFit We need to increase opportunity and decrease poverty.  Only one thing will do so, economic growth.
@BRockFit which WSJ article?
@BRockFit  Look at who has the greatest growth in jobs.  And who used to control those states.  How about the poorest cities?
@BRockFit Why do you think they do?  ObamaCare could have solved this problem.  Didn't.
@BRockFit Insurance companies supported and support ObamaCare.  Should tell you something.
@BRockFit Which would you choose?
@BRockFit That's simply untrue.  Democrats foster government dependence.  Republicans encourage self reliance and dignity.
@BRockFit Who do you think appoints Supreme Court Justices?
@BRockFit  The Courts decisions on ObamaCare, abortion and same sex marriage look to you like Republicans are controlling the Court?
@BRockFit  you seem not to understand that saying something is true is different than its being true.
@BRockFit Again, a Democrat talking point with no substance.
@BRockFit Also, that obviously does not explain either the Senate majority or the governorships.
@BRockFit RepeatingDemocrat talking points is not the same as defending your position.
@BRockFit You jump from issue to issue like you're unable to defend your position on any issue.
@BRockFit So you think they elected Obama, passed ObamaCare and Dodd-Frank not to mention the wasted stimulus.
@BRockFit By the way, Republicans didn't setup the current system.  Your party did.  And it doesn't work.
@BRockFit We need to make health insurance competitive and less expensive. Government can't do that.
@BRockFit And you'll have the kind of inferior healthcare other counties have.  Why do you think doctors become doctors?
@BRockFit I'm unsure what you're referring to. If we are looking to reduce poverty and increase opportunity, free markets are all you need.
@BRockFit Why did the jobs leave and how can we attract jobs to this country.  More regulation and income redistribution?  I think not.
@BRockFit That's ridiculous, but not unexpected.  Heaven forbid that voters should actually have to identify themselves.
@BRockFit How do you become the party that sets congressional boundaries?  Think about it.
@BRockFit Luckily, we have a democracy.
@BRockFit About the only thing the GOP doesn't have is the Presidency, yet.  We'll see what happens in this election.
@BRockFit Republicans have had a renaissance over the past 6 years. Now have majorities in the House, Senate, and have 33 governorships.
@BRockFit I would add increasing opportunity.  If we can decrease poverty an increase opportunity, income inequality will diminish.
@BRockFit We have and are happy to sell low fat, low carb and low cal products.
@BRockFit Rather than attacking an industry made up of small business franchisees, how about encouraging healthful eating?
@BRockFit Do you feel entitled to misrepresent to your community how fast food, which can be healthful, affects their health?
@BRockFit actually, we use attractive young women to see a variety of products. unsure how this relates to healthful food or labor costs.
@BRockFit http://t.co/8VmYbFq0KB.

@BRockFit After6 years of progressive Econ policy, it's a good thing any companies are left.
@BRockFit We have low fat, low carb, Low cal products.  People get to choose what they eat.

@BRockFit lowest 50% pay no tax.  Upper 10% pay about 33%.  Should be flatter and fairer.
